info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 08 at 8:18AM CST by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT BROWN AND SOUTHEASTERN COLEMAN COUNTIES THROUGH 915 AM CST... At 817 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Pioneer to Gouldbusk. Movement was northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Brownwood, Early, Santa Anna, Bangs, Blanket, Gouldbusk, Lake Brownwood Near Thrifty, May, Cross Cut, Lake Brownwood, Zephyr, Brookesmith, Rockwood, Byrds, Grosvenor, Lake Brownwood State Park, Camp Bowie, Trickham, Owens, and Thrifty. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
